intro: Gynoxys lopezii, commonly known as the Lopez's gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
